chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kquinton L Hadley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars or clubs.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Report to Racine Vocational Ministry Program. Comply with family court order. Pay ZCI fees. Firearm warning given. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.   **AMENDED 10-18-2017:  Lift of stayed conditional time - defendant to serve 298 days with credit from 08-19-2017.

***AMENDED 1/17/2018:  EFFECTIVE 1-18-2018, defendant is eligible for HUBER release for work and work search.***

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:***MODIFIED TO INCLUDED: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.****  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
